decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive, low-cost creature cards in white to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to flood the board with cheap creatures, buff them with anthem effects like Benalish Marshal and Heroic Reinforcements, and control the opponent's resources with Conclave Tribunal. The deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and apply pressure early in the game to force the opponent on the defensive. With a strong emphasis on efficient creature spells and combat tricks, the deck seeks to win through fast and overwhelming attacks.

This deck focuses on casting cheap spells to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries, enabling the recursion of powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake. Cards like Opt and Chart a Course help dig for key pieces, while Goblin Electromancer reduces the cost of spells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and aggressive creatures to close out the game as quickly as possible. The deck's strength lies in its ability to efficiently utilize its resources and maintain a steady stream of threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, board wipes, and removal spells, while also drawing and gaining life to outvalue the opponent. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate advantage. Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Crackling Drake serve as win conditions, providing a solid threat in the late game. The deck aims to stall the game out until it can establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its card advantage and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake, Arclight Phoenix, and Enigma Drake while using spells like Lava Coil, Shock, and Dive Down to control the board and protect your creatures. Card draw and selection is important with cards like Tormenting Voice, Chart a Course, and Opt to ensure you have the right cards at the right time. Utilizing cards like Goblin Electromancer and Radical Idea allow for cheaper spells and additional card advantage to keep the pressure on your opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures and removal spells. It utilizes a mix of aggressive creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Resplendent Angel, backed up by powerful spells like History of Benalia and Lava Coil. The key strategy is to establish a formidable board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice and Rekindling Phoenix provide additional threats and resilience to removal. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly generating spells and creatures in order to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. With cards like Goblin Electromancer and Crackling Drake, the deck aims to play multiple spells in a turn, while also utilizing cards like Arclight Phoenix to bring back threats from the graveyard. The deck also includes removal and card draw spells to maintain its aggressiveness and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost, efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent and gain control of the board. It aims to establish early dominance with cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia, while also using cards like Conclave Tribunal to remove any threats. The main strategy is to go wide with a swarm of creatures and utilize cards like Pride of Conquerors and Venerated Loxodon to buff them up for a strong, aggressive offense. The deck's aggressive playstyle and reliance on white creatures make it a formidable force in the current meta.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures. By consistently playing low-cost creatures and using cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia to generate tokens, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Conclave Tribunal provide removal options, while Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants can provide additional value by buffing creatures or bringing them back from the graveyard. Overall, this deck relies on speed and aggression to dominate the battlefield.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and aggressive playstyle. By efficiently utilizing low-cost creatures like Skymarcher Aspirant and Snubhorn Sentry, alongside token generators like Legion Warboss and Goblin Instigator, the deck aims to flood the board and apply pressure early on. History of Benalia helps to further strengthen the board presence, while cards like Heroic Reinforcements and Conclave Tribunal provide additional utility and removal options. With a focus on speed and efficiency, this deck looks to close out games swiftly before opponents have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, aggressive creatures. By using cards like Dauntless Bodyguard, Benalish Marshal, Adanto Vanguard, and Heroic Reinforcements, the player can build a strong board presence early in the game. Cards like History of Benalia and Legion's Landing help to provide additional support and maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Tocatli Honor Guard helps to shut down creature-based strategies from the opponent, while Pride of Conquerors can provide a powerful finisher for the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to swarm the board with low-cost white creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Skymarcher Aspirant, Benalish Marshal, and Venerated Loxodon to boost the power of the weenie creatures and push for lethal damage quickly. Supporting cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia help create token creatures and provide additional battlefield presence. Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants offers utility and recursion options, while Conclave Tribunal provides removal. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, relentless, and dominating in the early game.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with small creatures like Saprolings and then buff them with cards like Venerated Loxodon and Flower / Flourish to swarm the opponent and overwhelm them with sheer numbers. Cards like Trostani Discordant and Shalai, Voice of Plenty help protect and support your creatures, while History of Benalia provides additional token generation. The deck aims to curve out smoothly and maintain a strong board presence to apply constant pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Fanatical Firebrand, supported by powerful spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game as quickly as possible. Experimental Frenzy provides card advantage and allows for explosive turns, while cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Viashino Pyromancer help maintain momentum and board presence. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with consistent damage and efficient plays.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's board while gradually gaining card advantage and value over time. The deck utilizes removal spells, counterspells, and discard effects to keep the opponent's threats at bay, while also running powerful win conditions like Nicol Bolas, the Ravager and Doom Whisperer. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by drawing cards, gaining life, and controlling the board until it can establish a dominant position and close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and quick damage output. By utilizing low-cost spells and creatures, such as Shock, Lightning Strike, and Goblin Chainwhirler, the deck aims to continuously apply pressure and chip away at the opponent's life total. Experiment Frenzy provides card advantage and allows for explosive turns, while cards like Viashino Pyromancer and Runaway Steam-Kin help to maintain board presence. The inclusion of Rekindling Phoenix adds a resilient threat to the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and turn the game around.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures early on while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Carnage Tyrant and Jadelight Ranger, supported by cards like Find / Finality and Vraska, Golgari Queen for additional value. The deck also utilizes ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Rejuvenator to accelerate its tempo. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Vivien Reid and Vraska, Relic Seeker adds versatility and allows for different avenues of attack. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.
